headline: If you are a human being, you should not work here
pros:
NONE for ICICI Securities.
For the job role as Equity Advisor:
1) You get knowledge of the stock market and equity, derivatives and MF products first hand
2) You understand the value of investing
cons:
1) Orthodox work culture- My boss specifically asked me to call everyone by Sir/Ma'am. Very vertical organisation, upper management is not approachable, pathetic infrastructure
2) Inhuman treatment to new joinees and freshers- To visit my father who had a heart attack, I got an unpaid leave even though i had many leaves. Have to come to work on saturdays and you will not get any pay for overtime. the seniors try to get the work done by their freshers. freshers are forced to come to work even on public holidays.  I was forced to come on Diwali, i did not though. 
3) Biased HR- the HR policies of the company is like a dictatorship regime. Strict and biased against the freshers and very complacent for the seniors. It is very easy to manipulate HR. The HR will not tend to your needs as an employee.
4) the role of equity advisor is just a fancy term it is just telesales. the targets are completely unrealistic. 
5) no perks- on diwali, they took Rs 200 from us and then fed us cold biryani and rock hard gulab jamun and decorated the office with paper craft thats all. 
No parties ever. DO NOT WORK FOR THIS COMPANY IF YOU WANT TO DO SOMETHING IN FINANCE. This company is just a glamorous telecalling company. Pathetic management, pathetic seniors.
6) no work life balance- you are expected to come in at 8:30 in the morning and go at 8 pm in the night and then do almost full day on saturdays as well WITHOUT ANY PAY. they dont care about your personal life and your personal things.
6)  no growth- after 5 years you might have a better package of 8-9 lakhs if you work day and night but you cannot afford a very swanky life with it. and even if you become the regional head, you still have to deal with stupid people on call who dont have any manners and they literally insult you on call.
